page.title: 15Raskelf and Hunting
page.content: The village of Raskelf has firm connections with hunting.In the Domesday Book Raskelf is spelt Rascill and is often pronounced like this today.The name of the village can be traced Ra (roe deer) and skelf (shelf of land).This implies that roe deer would have been found upon the ridge where Raskelf now stands.When Richard III was living in the castle at Sheriff Hutton he hunted at Raskelf.Today hunting is still a pastime enjoyed and encouraged by some people in the area. It has been quite widely hunted by the York and Ainsty hunt.Few people expressed opposition to this kind of hunting though whale hunting was less popular.
